Title: Corrigendum to: “Does outcome measurement of treatment for substance use disorder reflect the personal concerns of patients? A scoping review of measures recommended in Europe” [Drug Alcohol Dependence 179 (2017) 299–308] (S0376871617303691) (10.1016/j.drugalcdep.2017.05.049))
Abstract: © 2018The authors regret, in this paper, it came to their attention that a correction was needed in one of its figures. More specifically, in Fig. 3 they had accidentally included the instrument “Measurements in the Addictions for Triage and Evaluation” in the group of measures classified as “not focussing directly on substance misuse” which is incorrect, since “substance misuse” is one of the domains which this instrument covers, as shown in Table 2. The corrected version of Fig. 3 is now presented below. It is also worth mentioning that the correction of this figure does not change the findings of the paper, nor has this information been presented elsewhere in the manuscript. The authors would like to apologise for any inconvenience caused.
